intro: Leschenaultia, commonly known as the mountain daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are native to South America, particularly in regions of Argentina, Chile, and Peru. Leschenaultia species are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers that typically range in color from white to pink and yellow. They often grow in high-altitude environments, such as grasslands and shrublands, and are adapted to cold and dry conditions. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value.
